kjv_def: have, hold (fast), keep (in memory), let, X make toward, possess, retain, seize on, stay, take, withhold
strongs_def: to hold down (fast), in various applications (literally or figuratively)
outline:
1. to hold back, detain, retain
    1. from going away
    2. to restrain, hinder (the course or progress of)
      1. that which hinders, Antichrist from making his appearance
      2. to check a ship's headway i.e. to hold or head the ship
    3. to hold fast, keep secure, keep firm possession of
  2. to get possession of, take
    1. to possess
